cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest just off the Florida east coast, then turning north and north-northeast and accelerating toward the Georgia/South Carolina coast and the mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast

weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL to Ocracoke Inlet, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast northward through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Monday morning as the center passes just offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible along the northeast Florida coast including St. Johns River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with isolated 4-inch pockets possible; mainly brief heavy squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief coastal erosion possible.
